definition: road congestion/traffic jam
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
strategic pass/tactical border position
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with

sentences.english: Aggressive and timid driving behavior is what leads to stop-and-go traffic.
sentences.chinese: 膽大和膽小的駕馭行爲導致了交通堵塞。

sentences.english: The accident blocked all traffic at the rotary.
sentences.chinese: 事故造成了三叉路口的交通堵塞。

sentences.english: NO01, Double-parking is illegal, and it blocks traffic.
sentences.chinese: 並排停車是違法的，而且也會造成交通堵塞。

sentences.english: The traffic on the South Zhongshan Road near the Zhonghua Gate is jammed.
sentences.chinese: 中山南路中華門段上有交通堵塞。

sentences.english: Traffic jam caused by the celebration of the Diwali in North India
sentences.chinese: 北印度排燈節節慶所致的交通堵塞。

sentences.english: The accident snarled up traffic for hours.
sentences.chinese: 事故使交通堵塞數小時。

sentences.english: The mini-bus is late because of the traffic jams during the rush hour.
sentences.chinese: 下班高峯時段，小公共因爲交通堵塞晚點了。

sentences.english: With the number of private cars increasing②, traffic jams in metropolitans are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 私家車的增多必然產生大城市交通堵塞。

sentences.english: The motorist enjoys an unobstructed view of the natural scenery as he drives across the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 躲開交通堵塞，去看看鄉村的自然風光，真太愜意了。

sentences.english: Moscow also has different reasons for traffic jams.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科的交通堵塞也有不同的原因。

sentences.english: Rubber-necking at accidents on the opposite side of the road seem to cause most of the senseless traffic jams.
sentences.chinese: 對向車道看熱鬧的人引起了最多無意義的交通堵塞。

sentences.english: And like automobiles facing traffic snarls, light can encounter delays, too.
sentences.chinese: 就像汽車會遇到交通堵塞，光也有延遲的問題。

sentences.english: Most of the important cities of the world suffer from traffic jam.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多數大城市都交通堵塞爲患。

sentences.english: I spent my first two hours in Bangkok stuck in crosstown traffic.
sentences.chinese: 在曼谷的頭兩個小時，我就爲市區的交通堵塞所困。

sentences.english: They creep along in miles long traffic jams on the interstate.
sentences.chinese: 汽車總是爬行在州際之間的英里長的交通堵塞中。

sentences.english: Huge traffic jams are common in China on some mountain roads.
sentences.chinese: 大型的交通堵塞在中國的一些山路上十分常見。

definition: traffic jam
(of traffic) to become congested/congestion
traffic congestion
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
traffic jam
pedestrian-vehicle mixed use
mixed use (e.g. pedestrians and vehicles)/joint operation (e.g. trains and buses)
traffic/rate of traffic flow
vehicle
highway/expressway/same as 高速公路[gao1 su4 gong1 lu4]
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
traffic lane/driveway
to jaywalk
road closure/to close a road
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
